text:
Some code of mine is broken, I think after some update. I can't invert this (reshaped) static matrix. Is this a bug? Is it me? Any ideas?...

```julia> v = SVector(1,0,0.1,0,2,0,0,0,1);

julia> H = reshape(v,3,3);

julia> inv(H)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching factorize(::Base.ReshapedArray{Float64,2,SArray{Tuple{9},Float64,1,9},Tuple{}})
Closest candidates are:
  factorize(::StridedArray{T, 2}) where T at /home/nicolau/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/dense.jl:1207
  factorize(::LinearAlgebra.Adjoint) at /home/nicolau/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/dense.jl:1283
  factorize(::LinearAlgebra.Transpose) at /home/nicolau/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/dense.jl:1284
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] inv(::Base.ReshapedArray{Float64,2,SArray{Tuple{9},Float64,1,9},Tuple{}}) at /home/nicolau/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/generic.jl:1047
 [2] top-level scope at REPL[77]:1```

text:
You can construct a `SMatrix` directly
```julia> H = SMatrix{3, 3}(1, 0, 0.1, 0, 2, 0, 0, 0, 1)
3×3 SArray{Tuple{3,3},Float64,2,9} with indices SOneTo(3)×SOneTo(3):
 1.0  0.0  0.0
 0.0  2.0  0.0
 0.1  0.0  1.0

julia> inv(H)
3×3 SArray{Tuple{3,3},Float64,2,9} with indices SOneTo(3)×SOneTo(3):
  1.0  0.0  0.0
  0.0  0.5  0.0
 -0.1  0.0  1.0```
Concerning the fact it may be a bug, it is not clear to me if reshaping a `SVector` could return a `SMatrix` and I doubt `Base.ReshapedArray` should be invertible.

elements.text:
julia> H = SMatrix{3, 3}(1, 0, 0.1, 0, 2, 0, 0, 0, 1)
3×3 SArray{Tuple{3,3},Float64,2,9} with indices SOneTo(3)×SOneTo(3):
 1.0  0.0  0.0
 0.0  2.0  0.0
 0.1  0.0  1.0

julia> inv(H)
3×3 SArray{Tuple{3,3},Float64,2,9} with indices SOneTo(3)×SOneTo(3):
  1.0  0.0  0.0
  0.0  0.5  0.0
 -0.1  0.0  1.0

text: Yeah, I moved to SMatrix. It was working for me before, though.
